intro: Bupleurum commutatum f. tauricum, commonly known as the Tauric Bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, finely toothed margin. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
